lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Volcker's tenure at the Fed began under the cloud of major inflation under Carter with consumer prices rising more than 10 per cent annually and the prime interest rate exceeding 20 per cent.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: With Reagan's backing, Volcker pursued a tight money policy that cut inflation to about three per cent annually and reduced interest rates to their lowest level in nearly a decade.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Financial markets reacted with dismay at the departure of Volcker, who has been widely credited with holding the line on inflation and seeking to maintain stability in currency values.
